portfolio.title: Social Network
portfolio.description: A single page application for users to interact with other users, built in React.
portfolio.text: This was the first time using React and I loved it! It was a challenge to wrap my head around, especially later on when I started using Redux and Sockets, but it was so much fun and I'm very happy with how it turned out. When it came to design, I styled it from scratch and mobile first. May or may not look familiar, but sometimes the smartest thing you can do is a master copy, right?
bullet-points: Node.js with Express and a SQL database backend
Storing user information in SQL, uploading profile pictures to AWS S3
Authentication with Node, Bcrypt and Cookie-Session, where the cookies are protected by using a csurf package
Reset password functionality: A key with an expiration date gets stored in a Redis Database and gets send out via AWS SES. If the entered key checks out, the user can change the password.
Edit profile functionality
Find other users functionality
Friend other users functionality with SQL in the back and React in the front
Live Chat with socket.io
React Redux frontend
UI master copy of Instagram with CSS
Mobile first

portfolio.title: Connect Four
portfolio.description: Classic two player connect four game, built in Javascript with jQuery.
portfolio.text: This was one of my favorite projects! There were a lot of challenging parts to this one, for example, figuring out when somebody's won diagonally. I wanted to make it as accessible as possible, so the game is fully playable using the keyboard. If I had more time, I would like to add functionality to make if fully playable using a screen reader and voice commands. Styling it was extremely rewarding, when it all came together in the end..
bullet-points: Game logic for moving the pieces and determining when a win has occured using Javascript with jQuery.
Intuitive UX with CSS animations
Strong focus on accessibility
Dark Mode

portfolio.title: Petition
portfolio.description: A page for signing a petition, all done with Node.js, Express and Handlebars.
portfolio.text: Hire me! This project marked the time where I was introduced to a little more complex data flow and the dynamics of working with #node and #sql extensively. I had a blast. It's live on hire-me-petition.herokuapp.com, feel free to check it out!
bullet-points: Node Express and SQL database backend
Authentication with Node, Bcrypt and Cookie-Session, where the cookies are protected from malicious tampering with using a csurf package
Edit profile functionality
Signature, using a HTML Canvas Element and Javascript
See other signers name, age, city, message etc.
Delete your signature functionality
Styled using Bootstrap 4

portfolio.title: Image Board
portfolio.description: A single page application image board with comment functionality, built in Vue.js.
portfolio.text: First time working with Vue. This project came to life when I realized the world was in need of more blurry and shaky b-roll images. Everybody has the permission to upload or delete any picture, that guarantees there are no bad pictures on the site. The comment section underneath a picture is where the real action is at, just like on reddit or youtube. My plans for the future are to come up with a better branding and to deploy this.
bullet-points: A Node Express and SQL database backend
New images get handled using Multer, then uploaded to AWS S3, a reference gets stored in the database
The image board displayes the 20 most recent pictures, upon scrolling down more images are being loaded and displayed
Navigation is provided with hash routing
Useres can write comments on individal images
Users can delete images

portfolio.title: Quiz
portfolio.description: A digitalized experience of Max Frisch's Book "Fragebogen" from 1988, a succession of philosophical questions.
portfolio.text: This was a response to when I was reading the book, but didn't want to have to carry around a pencil and paper at all times to answer the questions. In transforming it into a web site, users can not only answer the questions a lot more efficiently, but could potentially create a completely different set of answers in different periods of time and go back, seeing how they answered it for example a year ago versus now.
bullet-points: A Node Express backend
Utilizing Node's core "fs"-module, user information gets stored in server side JSON files
Users can browse different chapters
Strictly translating the cover, text and overall layout of the original book with CSS

portfolio.title: Rejection Leaderboard
portfolio.description: A place to celebrate the hustle that is finding a job as a junior and provide motivation to keep going.
portfolio.text: A fun little project to see who has the most unanswered applications and job offer rejections. This helps to show that everybody gets rejections and your value as a person is not defined by the success in your career. Lets celebrate the person with the most rejections and encourage them to keep going!
bullet-points: A very simple Node Express Backend using Airtable as a database
Frontend built in React
Deployment to firebase, setting up the server and airtable as a cloud function
